AA5: Getting Meshy! and Lamps!

Mesh & Lamp

Posted by Joyce on November 8, 2022

The documentaion for this week includes 2 main sections. The first one is a how I edited different meshes to combine them as a whole; the second part includes the process of printing the 11 objects.

Editing the Mesh

I don't have real flowers at my place so I think it'll be nice to have some 3D printed ones. I found a creation that I'm interested on Thingverse, which comes with 3 pieces: a rose, the stem, and a vase

There are already closed meshes so I just have to position them together and then "join" them in Rhino. Afterwards, it's a single object and is still a closed mesh.

Preparing for the Lamp

I went to Thingverse and downloaded some nice-looking lamps. However, after adjusting the size to the smalledst possbile, many of them still need 8+ hours to print as estimated by Cura. Eventually, I was able to find one that requires 6ish hours and I decided to go with it.

First, I measured the width of the lamp innerds and the power plug. The former is approximately 36mm and the latter is 26mm. Next, I imported the lamp file into Rhion and measured the diameter of the opening, which was 39mm. Therefore, I scaled the whole object by 0.85.

Lastly, I opened up the stl file in Cura to make estimate how it will take to 3D print this.

-----

Hre's the link to the Thingverse creation

https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4761613/files
